title: Pinging your Mana should tell allies the AMOUNT of Mana you have left (not %)
body:
I understand they want to make it similar to Health, since they're right next to each other, but for gameplay purposes it makes much more sense to have Health pinged as a % and Mana pinged as a flat value.

When you ping Health and you're at 10% then that means you're close to death, no matter who you are. If you ping Mana and you're at 10% what exactly does that mean? You could be a {{champion:13}}  and still have multiple rotations till you're OOM or a {{champion:99}} who maybe can use one more ability.

For example if I'm {{champion:37}}  and my ult is about to come off cooldown but I won't have the mana to cast it, wouldn't my allies benefit a lot more from seeing that I have "40 mana" than 6% mana or whatever? 

The mana costs of abilities are constant. I know a {{champion:37}}  who pings "40 mana" cannot ult or heal. I don't know what a {{champion:37}}  with 6% mana at any given level/item build/masteries/runes can do.

When im against a Blitzcrank for example, i keep an eye on his mana. He needs 125 mana to pull and knock. 225 to ulti as well as pull and knock. I tell the ADC in words what he does based on his mana. If i only saw his mana% that tells me nothing at all. He could be able to do his full rotation, or he could be be unable to even pull.

I'm not suggesting changing what happens when you ping an ability. That should stay the same. I'm talking about pinging your mana bar.

Sometimes it's about to come off cooldown shortly, however (as your allies can see your ult cooldown), and you'd want to let your allies know it's not gonna be able to be used.

Almost all champions' ults have 100 mana. I think it would be much more beneficial to have this change as opposed to the % value it tells you now which really means nothing. If all it tells you by virtue of pinging one's mana they don't have the mana for a gank, then this change would have no effect on you because pinging a flat value would end up serving the same purpose.

Ok....... So for Clarification because it seems some people are confused as to what this post is about.

1. If you ping an ability that is ON COOLDOWN but only has like 10 seconds left... but you DO NOT have mana for it.... It will still only ping the time remaining, which creates confusion and makes people think that its a good time to engage.
2. Pinging the mana bar gives a mana % currently......
1) Yes, the majority of people will ping saying they do not have enough.
2) Yes, most people do not have the slightest idea what other champion's mana costs are.
3) Yes there are people who do ping the mana to say they DO have the mana to go in.
---

Now for my opinion......

1. If an ability says "Q - Not Enough Mana. X Mana Cost." saying the cost of the ability.... Suggestion from DarkRitual on this thread.
2. If when pinging the mana bar it says Current mana in Flat and % Value.....
1) It would add clarity for both those that dont want to worry about the costs of another champions abilities.
2) It would help out those that DO know the other champions abilities, and if paired with number 1. It would potentially help people who pay attention to these things know what they actually CAN do and what they CAN NOT.
3. For a more custom fit........ In the "In Game" options, it could be an option to see pings of HP and Mana as Flat... %..... Or have the ability to have them both on.

Why not both? (30%- 180 mana)

Same goes for HP
When i pinged 5% Mana on{{champion:34}} and the team still decides to fight without me and lose then flame me for not fighting with them, good times

This thread makes absolutely no sense.

It could just text "X's mana is low!" Even less information. The point that someone bothered to ping it gets the point across especially if it says a low % of mana. If it was a number you'd have to take account the level of the game, and sometimes the champion and his build. And it could be Anivia with 600 mana but with RoA/Archangles which would sound a lot coming from a bruiser.

If someone pings their mana, it's because they think they feel they don't have enough to get enough casts out and don't want to fight. No need for any changes on this, considering no one is ever going to ping mana to show they have enough to fight.

Your proposition does not help with clarity.
Percentile is just switched for a flat amount and this doesn't change a thing unless people know each champion's spell costs. Which is absurd.

10% HP (just as 10% mana) is meant to mean "i'm low on HP/resource". And that in turn means that you shouldn't engage a fight with an ally that's low on one or the other, or both.
You're not going to do calculations based on someone else's mana pool in terms of how much of a rotation can they pull off on the remaining mana they have. It's their job to think about that and it's your job to think about yours.
